website_summaries.verdict: The best budget, manual way to massage the calves and other leg muscles with ease.
pros: Beaded design digs into the calves as the stick rolls across the skin
The large surface area hits an entire cross section of muscle at once
Good for other muscles as well
cons: Solid beads can cause pain in overly tense muscles
May tire out the arms and hands

customer_reviews.title: Great Value & Performance
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this roller for several days now. I run 20 - 30 miles a week and this roller really helps with recovery. Some reviews have mentioned this pulling leg hair but I (41 Male) haven't had any problems with that and I usually use it directly on the skin with no clothing between the roller and my legs.
customer_reviews.author: ia_hwks

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Study, effective & affordable.
customer_reviews.text: As a massage therapist I highly recommend this product! It's effective ans you can use it pretty much anywhere on the body. I use it on myself as well. It's worked wonders on my IT bands, inner thighs. My husband uses it on his arms and shoulders. This is an absolute must have! It's easy to use and well priced. All others I looked at were either cheaply made or super expensive. Im grateful I found this one, it's sturdy ans has held up well over daily use!
customer_reviews.author: Tawnie H

customer_reviews.title: Yeeees!...just right for this big guy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price! Works great. 5'11" here, about 250 lbs. Big calves. Perfect for working my calves. I relax the foot and muscles for best results, propping my heel gently up on my ottoman, bending at the knee. Can work all sides and angles and get deep into the muscle in that position.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: foam roller
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing for "doing" the very sore muscle on my thigh. Someone at a pharmacy dept at a grocery store recommend me use a foam roller. This one is very well made and designed.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps breakdown the fascia and pin point hard to reach places.
customer_reviews.text: I have had back surgery and in order to reach the hard to get areas of my back this is the item that was finally able to get it! I use it daily to breakdown the knots and more importantly the fascia that’s between the muscles. Not only does this act like a roller but also a pressure point self massager. I strongly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and home!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to take on a trip! I have several different modes of manipulation that I use at home but were all too large to pack. Now that I'm home I find I'm still using Sportneer 18 " Muscle Roller Stick Body Massage Sticks Tools-Muscle Roller Massager. Really helps and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: But hair is get caught in the rollers so where bike pants
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. While rolling it on my leg my leg hairs get caught up inside the rollers and it pulls at them. Not so comfortable. So I put on Long biking pants and then the product works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Peter Cantin

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: If you play sports or just would like relief from tight muscles, than this is the tool you need. Simple to use and really works those knots out. Recommend watching a video on the trigger points or where to hit for the best results.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have a horrible knot in my shoulder and this helps a lot with working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to the Foam rollers
customer_reviews.text: I started jumping rope at the age of 64 as its about the only cardio I can do as my knees are so messed up. It is a bit tough on your calves if you have never jumped rope before Your calves get very very sore As apart from your wrists they are the only muscle in your body that you use This product helped so much with my sore calves , so I use it before and after I jump rope as it has helped immensely Great product.
customer_reviews.author: martin gingell

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use this for stretching/rubbing out my legs. The one great thing about this specific roller is that the little rollers don't have space between them. With other leg rollers I have had problems with the rollers having space between them and then pinching skin. That is not the case for this leg roller. Works great! Super slim and little to so makes for easy storage when not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Muscle roller stick
customer_reviews.text: I used this after hip replacement for IT band bursitis. Have to be careful and not use too much pressure or it makes the pain worse
customer_reviews.author: sharon reiss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Both my mom and I often get cramps, or tightness in our leg muscles. Rather than carry the large foam roll on car trips, this will be perfect to take with us. I have used it several times, and very much appreciate the ease and smoothness with which it rolls on my muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Rose L Machayo Roper

customer_reviews.title: Good product worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Little harder than I expected bc I’ve used the foam rollers before. This is a hard plastic type but still does the same thing. You do not have to use much pressure to have deeper massage. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: KDrake

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my Warm up Routine
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to help me warm up my leg muscles before my daily walk. This takes about 1 minute and I'm good to go! Great Value too. I also use it before my stretching routine. So simple but so effective!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: Definitely awesome product for price!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this product. He is in the military so working out and sore muscles is apart of his life but since we have purchased this he now enjoys the ease of loosening his muscles up and taking the pain away with using this product!
customer_reviews.author: Harley  L Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: It’s amazing so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because, I tend to have really tight quads. I use this after a workout and its amazing it helps me stretch my muscles and relax them. I totally recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Angel-Bello

customer_reviews.title: good item
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Nice color, smooth rolling, relieving pain in legs, arms, neck, back and shoulers. Like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: lotus lu

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Small enough to fit in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Small enough to fit in a regular size backpack and long enough to use on several different areas of the body.
customer_reviews.author: JOSIE BARELA

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, handy
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. I keep it near the computer and use it often during the day. it seems to reduce my lower legs cramps by massaging the muscles. the price is also right.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchie

customer_reviews.title: Good quick massage tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to use for a quick roll out session of your sore muscles. Bought this to try and loosen up calf muscles for plantar fasciitis relieve, doesn’t get as deep as I’d like it to but still a good tool to use. I found a lacrosse ball is able to get in deeper into the muscle tissue than tools like these that tend to spread the pressure evenly over the calves.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Works but doesn't roll smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic, no silicone or metal bearings. Doesn't roll very smoothly. Still beneficial and works to relieve muscle tightness, but just very lack luster having previously used a better quality version.
customer_reviews.author: Candi Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use, but pulls hair
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, except one thing, it pulls hair like no other, I had to stop using it. The little rollers are independent and when they roll apart then together they make a tight pinch, pulling any hairs that might go between.
customer_reviews.author: David Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good price, and works well. I’ve had the original The Stick, and this is much firmer. And there seems to be less space between the wheels. I like that the wheels are ribbed, and the grips are good. All in all it’s worth it, just know it’s very firm.
customer_reviews.author: FR!TZ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Better than a rolling pin - not joking! I was using a rolling pin to massage my calves. Now my calves and my girlfriend are happy.
customer_reviews.author: knowmater

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my calf muscles when I get cramps or charlie horses. Easy to use. Works great

customer_reviews.title: Great for legs
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Easy to use By yourself. Takes a little bit of coordination but definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my leg muscle when I developed some plantar fasciitis issues. Very happy with it. Also works well for back massages.
customer_reviews.author: KittyMama

customer_reviews.title: Helps me get ready to run!
customer_reviews.text: I tore a calf muscle. My physical therapist recommended I get one of these, although she did recommend a specific brand. This one makes a world of difference when I'm getting ready to compete in a dog agility trial. It helps me stretch and relax that muscle, and get ready to run without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hauenstein

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, I would have preferred if the roller parts were rubberized. They don’t feel very comfortable or soothing as it is

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for anyone who likes to push your workouts, really rolls out tight Calfs, Quads, and others nicely. Can't beat the price either!

customer_reviews.title: Roller stick
customer_reviews.text: Love this use it for sore muscles and it actually helps a lot!

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the comfort grip. Easy to use. Worked the kinks right out.

customer_reviews.title: Most important tool in track bag
customer_reviews.text: Actually my second purchase of this, daughter misplaced her first one probably at a track meet. She has tight IT bands and uses this to help stretch and alleviate pain before and after races. She also uses this to roll my back which I suffer from chronic pain.

customer_reviews.title: Good product

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice

customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. It is just as described. Works perfect!!

customer_reviews.title: A great buy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This has helped with my tight IT band. If I use it regularly I don’t have any issues with my IT band.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Zero complaints. It's not soft so if you need foam look elsewhere, otherwise a good product.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write product reviews, and was highly suspect of how effective this would be. But I was so pleasantly surprised!! It is very easy to use, and I felt immediate results/muscle relief. I highly recommend you give it a try too.

customer_reviews.title: Really useful for after physical training!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, he trains wrestling and usually he is really sore after training, this roller stick really helped him to relax and massage his muscles after a hard work training, He really likes it and use it a lot. Is made from strong hard plastic, and the size is right.

product_meta.title: Muscle Roller Stick,Sportneer Massage Sticks for Athletes, Back Leg Muscle Massager for Reducing Soreness, Loosing Tightness, and Soothing Cramps
feature_bullets: MULTI-FUNCTIONAL: This massage tool provides deep tissue massage for foot, calves, legs, hamstring, back, glutes, quads, neck, sciatica, back and shoulder. Very efficient for relieving the pain such as shin splints, plantar fasciitis, sciatica, restless leg syndrome, tennis elbow,etc, to ease muscle soreness, aid recovery, reduce stiffness and pain before and after workouts

81 TRIGGER POINTS FOR DEEP TISSUE: 9 ABS independent rollers with segmented spondles, each rolling spindle engineered to hit even the smallest pressure points and muscle fibers for a deep tissue massaging experience

DURABLE & HIGH QUALITY MATERIALS: This massage stick roller is made with industrial strength materials, thermoplastic rubber and polypropylene handles for comfort and grip, 9 ABS independent rollers on a reinforced steel rod core for a lasting durability

DUAL GRIP HANDLE W/ CONVEX POINTS DESIGN: The design of this muscle roller ensures a steady grip that works effortlessly with you for the most efficient muscle massage and relief ; DUAL grip design helps you hit those hard-to-reach spots and allows for uncomplicated self-massages
COMPACT & LIGHTWEIGHT: Ideal for both home and travel, take to the gym, use at home and/or sports fields etc, fit perfectly in your gym bag
